team19.weatherapp

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • team19.weatherapp.Utilities

  • public class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object
    The Utilities class contains methods that allow us to convert between units. This is useful for allowing other classes to quickly change Temperature Units, Speed Units, etc.
    Author:
    Scott Mackie

      Utilities()

      The convertTemp method converts a temperature value from Kelvin to Celsius or Fahrenheit.

    • Method Detail

      • convertTemp

        public static int convertTemp(char unit,
                              double temp)
        The convertTemp method converts a temperature value from Kelvin to Celsius or Fahrenheit. If the unit variable is invalid, it returns error temperature -99999.
        Parameters:
        unit - Unit to be converted to (F for Fahrenheit, C for Celsius)
        temp - The value which will be converted
        Returns:
        Returns the converted temperature

      • convertSpeed

        public static double convertSpeed(char unit,
                                  double speed)
        The convertSpeed method converts a temperature value to Kilometers or Miles. If the unit variable is invalid, it returns error speed -99999.
        Parameters:
        unit - Unit to be converted to (K for Kilometers, M for Miles)
        speed - The value which will be converted
        Returns:
        Returns the converted speed

      • convertColor

        public static int[] convertColor(double input)

      • getImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage(java.lang.String pathAndFileName)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        The getImage method allows us to safely load image files as bufferedimages. This makes it much easier to package our final product as a runnable jar file.
        Parameters:
        pathAndFileName - Location that the image should be loaded from
        Returns:
        The requested bufferedImage file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file could not be found, throws an error
